quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Merry Christmas! [holds up dead goose and puts it on Pam's desk]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Merry Christ--[looks up] NO! Why... why did you bring that here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Don't worry, she's dead. Oh wait. He's dead.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Dwight, what uh...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I accidentally ran over it. It's a Christmas miracle!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well, get it out of here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Relax, OK. And because this is Christmas, I am going to roast this goose and prepare it with a wild rice dressing. Do we have any cayenne pepper in the kitchen?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Merry Christmas Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow. What have we got here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What does it look like?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Dead goose.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: And circle gets the square.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [to Pam] So can you watch this? I'm gonna get my carving knife out of the trunk.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Oh, Dwight, we talked about this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, Toby, this is different. He's already dead.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Once I brought in a duck. To prepare for lunch. And people got upset. Apparently, they got attached to the duck and didn't want to see it killed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: He was already dead. And we Schrutes use every part of the goose. The meat has a delicious, smoky, rich flavor. Plus you can use the molten goose grease and save it in the refrigerator, thus saving you a trip to the store for a can of expensive goose grease.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow. Win-Win.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Exactly. Thank you, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I like goose. If it's already dead is it so crazy we eat it?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: That's crazy. It's crazy.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Dwight, you cannot keep that here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ok, that is ridiculous. And totally against the spirit of Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Come on Dwight. We went over this, like for a half an hour.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's Christmas Toby.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: It's a dead animal in an office. You can't...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Toby...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [sighs] Please? Please?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Clean it in your car.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I would like it off my desk.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh Pam. Take a chill pill.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [Riding a bicycle down the hallway and singing] Deck the halls with boughs of holly. Fa la la la la la la la la. [Struggling to stay on] 'Tis the ... ack. [expletive] Hey! [to Pam] I would like a nice slice of Christmas Pam. Side of candied Pams. And perhaps, some Pam-chops, with mint...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Can I help you, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm looking for the toy drive box.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It's behind you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK...  Well, I need to put this bike in there. I hope it'll fit, with all these little knickknacks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow. What kind of bike is that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Umm... I don't know? Average kind?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: The tires look pretty worn.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, that is probably from the test drive.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: But the paint's chipping. Is that your old bike, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yo, Michael, sweet ride Mike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, thanks. [Michael and Andy do a fist bump and explosion.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes? [Pam holds up a bag] Oh Pam, that is so sweet. You didn't have to do that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [hands over bag] I didn't, it's from corporate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK. Did everybody get one of these?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Terrific. Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This is going to be the best Christmas ever. My girlfriend Carol is coming to our party tonight, and I have a little surprise for her. [singing] I've got two tickets to paradise! Pack your bags, we're leaving the day-after-tomorrow! Um,  taking her to Sandals, Jamaica, all-inclusive. All-inclusive. You know what that means? Right? Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Creed takes toy from toy drive box.] Oh, I think you're supposed to put a toy in the box, Creed.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: And a happy holiday to you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Carol walks through door looking upset] [waves] Carol.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: Hi, is Michael around here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: There she is. A Christmas Carol. Hello [kisses Carol] You're about five hours early to the party. You're such a blonde. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, everybody. I don't know who you haven't met yet, but I think this is one of them. This is my girlfriend - Carol. This is just the front of her. Show 'em, show 'em the other side.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: [whispers] What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Turn around, turn around. Come on. [making a body turning gesture]

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: Get outta here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, you get outta here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Michael

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: If I may say. She's even prettier that you described her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [standing up] Oh, ouch. Michael, I don't think there is anything wrong with the way you described her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: I really need a moment alone with you. [Carol heads towards Michael's office.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Not as much as I need a moment alone with you. [puts finger on her back and reaches for her butt] Berp.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: What is this? [Holds up a Christmas photo]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That is my Christmas card. It's a picture of you and me and your kids on a ski trip, having a blast. Ski-sons Greetings.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: No. See, we never went on a ski trip.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: I went on a ski trip.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Right.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: Two years ago with my kids and my ex-husband.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes, but what you didn't realize at the time was that I was with you in a sense. I was in your heart...

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And next to your kids. What?

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: This is so weird.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't understand?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It's a bold move, to Photoshop yourself into a picture with your girlfriend and her kids on a ski trip with their real father. But then again, Michael's a bold guy. [Towards unseen cameraman] Is bold the right word?

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: I think you're a really sweet guy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: But, um, I don't know how to deal with, with this thing [waves Christmas card]. And, and the proposal. And I don't think things are going to work out with us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no no no Ok, OK, You know what, you're not thinking straight. You know what you need? You need to think this through in [making drum noise] Jamaica's largest fresh water pool.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I got us tickets to Sandals, Jamaica, We leave day after tomorrow. [Carol shakes head in disappointment]. You better find the skimpiest bikini there is.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: Oh, no. Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And it's all inclusive.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: Michael...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, Carol. You walk out that door and it is over.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.line: I know. [Closes door.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Psst. Jim. [Jim turns around. Pam nods head towards her for him to come over] Um, hey. I need to give you your Christmas gift now because, well, I'll just tell you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: For the past few months I've been sending Dwight letters from the CIA. [hands a folder to Jim]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: They're considering him for a top secret mission. There's his application. Oh, and this is where I made him list every secret he promised he'd never ever tell.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Opens folder and reads from Dwight's file] Last year, my boss, Michael Scott, took a day off because he said he had pneumonia, but really, he was leaving early to go to magic camp. Wow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So... here's the gift. You get to decide what his top secret mission is. [Jim smiles] Sorry I didn't wrap it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [closes folder] You know what? Uh, I really don't think I should be doing this stuff anymore, you know?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, because of the promotion.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It just feels a little bit, like...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, I get it, of course. OK. [holds out hand for folder. Jim gives Pam back the folder.]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I feel like there's a chance for me to start over. And if I fall back into the same kind of things I used to do., then ... what am I doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'd like everybody's attention. Christmas is canceled.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: You can't cancel a holiday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Keep it up Stanley and you will lose New Year's.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: What does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Jim, take New Year's away from Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Michael, what's going on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Carol and I split up. Amicably. And I just don't think it would be appropriate to celebrate under the circumstances.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Will they still air 'Rudolph?'

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: That's not fair.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [over everybody else's talking] Are we gonna cancel Hanukah as well?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Fine! [everybody stops talking] Have your party. Just no guests.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: But we invited guests.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, you know what Phyllis? All of your guests would have probably canceled at the last minute anyway, leaving your life a stupid rotten mess.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, oh, oh, oh, it hurts.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It hurts my heart. It hurts my stomach. It hurts my arms.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: OK, well, why are you laying like that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [moves a little] Thanks. How did you push away the bad thoughts?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Like what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Like maybe, the real reason they left was because there were things they wanted you to do in bed, that were, foreign, and scary?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well.. um I, I don't...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And not that you didn't want to try them. Some wine may have helped. Do you know what I'm referring to?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I don't need to know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Michael. Sorry to interrupt. Uh, It appears we're one bathrobe short.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Take it from Toby.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Copy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, would you like to go to Sandals, Jamaica with me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's all... [Pam walks away.] OK.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey Dwight. Pretty nice robe- [Dwight grabs bag with robe in it and walks away.] Why?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Phyllis, I need you to pick up green streamers at lunch.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I thought you said green was whorish.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No, orange is whorish.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Uh, so I had a couple of ideas to make the Stamford people feel more at home. Each year we have a Christmas raffle ... [Phyllis and Pam nod their heads in agreement].

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: It would never work here.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Ok ... um, another idea was karaoke ...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: A Christmas drinking game ...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: God help you.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: These are all terrible ideas and none of them are on the theme of "A Nutcracker Christmas." I think you should leave.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: You're kidding.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: You tried this out, and it's clearly not for you. It's time to go. Come on. [Angela gets up from seat] Please. [Karen gets up and leaves] Thank you. OK, thank you very much. [Angela closes door]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What are you doing? ["Goodbye My Lover" by James Blunt plays]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [putting things into a box] We are getting rid of everything that reminds you of Carol.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey, what's the haps? [Dwight shuts door in his face.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Carol?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, look at this. [looks through papers] Your old condo closing papers. It's riddled with Carol's name. I wish I could throw this in the box. [Michael hits repeat to "Goodbye My Lover" on computer]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Why don't you just buy the whole song?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't have to buy it. I just want to taste it. I just... I just want a little taste of it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, look at this, she saved you two thousand dollars 'cause they failed to report a mold problem. [Continues to sift through papers] But wouldn't that affect the final... How did she? Oh, oh, I see what she did. That is good. Wow. Carol is one smart cookie.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [singing] Goodbye my lover. Goodbye my friend. [hits repeat again]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This is an old adage, but they say when you find true love, you know within the first 24 hours. With Carol, I knew within the first 24 minutes of the second day I met her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I feel like I've been kinda cold to Karen and there's no real reason for it. I mean it's not like she's ever done anything to me. So, I think I probably shouldn't be cold to her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey, Karen. Sorry about that meeting today, that was really crazy.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Yeah, right? I'm so glad you said that. Because, I don't know how those meetings usually go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Um, usually like that.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Does anyone ever stand up to Angela or..?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I think one of her cats did once. She came in with scratches all over her face. [both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Um, I really liked your karaoke idea.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Oh cool, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: That could really be fun.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Oh, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You guys do a raffle?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Yeah, we do a raffle...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey Kev.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Hey. [Toby puts hand on Kevin's back, who is wearing the robe and feels it a little bit.]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: This should've been up yesterday. [refers to party flyer]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: It'll be all right.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [Pam puts up another flyer] What is that? [Reads flyer] The "Committee to Plan Parties invites you to a margarita-karaoke Christmas?" There's no such thing as the "Committee to Plan Parties."

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: There is now. We just started it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Well, you just can't start a committee. You have to have funding.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: What's your funding?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Two hundred dollars.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What's ours again?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Umm, two hundred and one dollars.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh right.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [pointing] Hey, a margarita-karaoke Christmas party, that sounds like fun.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No, that is not a party. There's only one party and it's hosted by the Party PLANNING Committee and it starts at three o'clock.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Then why are there two flyers?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Oh, I understand that this is confusing for everyone, let me explain. There's a party that starts at three.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Right.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: And then there's a way more fun party that starts at two forty-five.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Right, and if you're interested in the way more fun party, all the info can be found here on our more brightly colored flyer. [Angela rips down brightly colored flyer and walks away. Karen rips down Angela's flyer.]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I didn't see where it was.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yup, looks like the Scranton people and the Stamford people are finally coming together. And that's what you want, right?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: I think that's a really good option...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Pam and Karen. I am ordering you to cease and desist all party planning. Immediately.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You can't do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: As ranking number three in this office, I am order -

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Umm... I'm number three.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You're number four.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah, but I'm number three.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ah, no. [to Pam and Karen] You must turn over to me all Christmas decorations and party paraphernalia immediately that will be returned to you on January fourth.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK, I think I can help here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ok, good

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: As ranking number two, I am starting a committee to determine the validity of the two committees and I am the sole member. The committee will act on this now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: OK, this is stupid.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Could you please keep it down? [interrupted Dwight] I'm in session. I've determined that this committee is valid. [Pam and Karen cheer.]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No no, no, wait, wait, wait [raises hand] Permission to join the Validity Committee.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Permission denied.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Damn it!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey. I can't concentrate when I know you're in pain, man. Let me take you to lunch. [Michael sighs.] C'mon, my treat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right. Nothing here to distract myself with anyway.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: That's my boy. I know the perfect place, too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hooters?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No. Benihana. Much classier. But don't worry, the babes are totally hot, too. [do a fist bump and explosion]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ah, I need my entourage [both exit Michael's office] Jim. Dwight. Ryan. C'mon, we're going to Asian Hooters.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Ah man, I can't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why not?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I'm not feeling so well. I've got a ton of work to do here. MSG allergy, peanut allergy, I just ate there last night. [Michael feels Ryan's forehead]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok, feel better.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: C'mon Jim, let's go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK. [to Ryan] Wow, thanks for taking all the excuses, dude.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Doctor appointment, car trouble, plantar warts, granddad fought in World War II. Use your head, man. I keep mine in here. [Holds up blackberry.] Look alive, Halpert. Welcome back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Bros before hos. Why? Because your bros are always there for you. They have got your back after your ho rips your heart out for no good reason. And you were nothing but great to your ho and you told her she was the only ho for you. And that she was better than all the other hos in the world. And then ... and then suddenly she's not yo' ho no mo'.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: So she looks really hot, so I said, "You look hotter than usual today." [to waitress] Thank you. Michael [gesturing to sit down.] Head of the table.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Get out Jim. [Dwight tries to sit between Andy and Jim] Actually, um... [to two other people at the table] Sir, I'm going to need take this chair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Dwight, just, just leave them alone please. They're on a date. They look very happy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: So she looks at me right, and she goes, "I'm sorry, don't I even know you?" After a year, a year of buying lattes from her, do you believe that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I can't... I can't here what you're saying.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Carol used to drink lattes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [off screen at other end of table] What're you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: She would get this little foam mustache...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [still off screen] Carol had a mustache?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And I used to say "Hey, got latte?" And she'd say, that's not funny.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [off screen] What are you guys talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: She totally got me. She understood that we didn't have to laugh to enjoy ---

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Michael! Repeat what you said louder!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It is my job to be there for Michael. How can I be there for Michael if I'm here for Michael? [food is thrown at Dwight's face]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm already starting to forget what color eyes she had. I can't, OK, I'm gonna call her. I am gonna call and find out...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Who are you calling?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm just gonna call her.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Put that away. Put that away. S.O.S. We... I... May day. Haha. Man down over here, [to waitress] we need your help.

quotes.speaker: Waitress
quotes.line: What can I get for 'ya?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I think we'll start with a round of noga-sakes. [waitress gives confused look]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: One part eggnog, three parts sake. Some places won't make it for you though, because eggnog is seasonal.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: You should, you should put out salt for the rims [referring to margaritas]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: That's a great idea.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Phyllis?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I was just getting a snack.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You can have your snack in here.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Pam, don't tell her what to do! Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: OK.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I think I'll go to Angela's party, because that's the party I know.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I miss the days when there was only one party I didn't want to go to.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: So I only use three?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: If you're using more than three pieces of tape to wrap a present, you're doing it wrong.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: OK. And where to do you get all those cool bows?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, I just get those at any party supply place.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: OK. Are you sure I can't use like, the cartoons from the newspaper?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh yeah, your mom would love that.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: [Karen walks in] Hey. All right, I'll see you guys later. [leaves room]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: He's cute. You should date him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, yeah... Maybe.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Looks like you've got a little Nakiri knife action going there.

quotes.speaker: Chef
quotes.line: No, it's Usuba.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah, I bet you wish you had a Nakiri, though.

quotes.speaker: Chef
quotes.line: Actually, the Usuba's the better knife when you're working with this quantity.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Nah, I don't know... Still think Nakiri's better.

quotes.speaker: Woman at bar
quotes.line: I think he'd know. [Dwight and her stare at each other]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Nothing he's doing is cheering me up.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Wait for the onion. Trust me. Hey Cindy, he just had his heart broken, you wouldn't do that to him, would you?

quotes.speaker: Cindy
quotes.line: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, sure you would. Look at you, I bet you break up with a guy every hour. [Cindy laughs and walks away]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You made her laugh. Yes! She totally digs us. [referring to what chef is doing] Watch, watch, watch, watch. [Onions smoke up] Heh, heh? What did I tell 'ya?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You're right. That's good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hello everyone. We would just like to announce that our party is starting now in the break room. So... you can come by... .

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I have a very important announcement to make... about... your paychecks. Umm... Your paychecks will be arriving as scheduled on Friday. And they will be in the correct amount that they are normally in... Please stand by for a very important announcement... refer..[starts to leave office] for further regarding your paycheck! [runs outside]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [on cell phone to Dwight] I need to know if I can start the party?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Michael! Hey! Over here, Michael! [waves down Michael with a napkin and whistles to get attention]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: This drink... [in audible conversation with Michael]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't know. No one can hear me. You know what? Start the party.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Did Michael give you permission to do this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [with conviction] Start the party.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [Angela slams phone shut and runs back to office.] Also, I would like to inform you that, um, as a special treat, my party will be starting early. In fact, it will be starting right now [opens door to conference room.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Our party is also starting now [opens door to break room.]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: [Stanley gets up and walks towards the break room.] All right Stanley. Woo.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Good choice. [Kelly drags Ryan to the break room.]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Welcome Hannah. You will not be disappointed.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.line: Why would I be disappointed?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I said you wouldn't be disappointed. [Meredith heads towards break room.]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Meredith, if you don't come to my party, you will be very, very sorry.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Is that a threat?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No, it's an invitation.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: We have vodka!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Lots of it! [Meredith leaves to break room party.]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I hear Angela's party will have double-fudge brownies. It will also have Angela. Double fudge... Angela... double fudge... Angela [puts out hands to weigh his options] Hmmm...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Brownies. Cupcakes. [Kevin walks toward conference room]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Don't push it.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Are we taking this too far? You know what, I don't think we're taking this far enough. [Pam and Karen look at each other] What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I got goose bumps.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I don't back down. My sister and I used to be best friends, and we haven't talked in 16 years. Over some disagreement, I don't even remember. So... yeah. I'm pretty good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ahh, damn this chicken is good. My compliments to the chef. [points to chef] Which is you! Right? Hahahaha. Awesome! I need some meat. I want some steak. [leans over to neighboring man's plate] I see steak.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.line: Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Excuse me [tries to take away meat with chopsticks] Ah, un guard. [Fights with chopsticks and laughs] Family style.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, it's not.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Cindy, Cindy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't think... I love it!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I want you to close your eyes and imagine your dream house. [Cindy laughs] C'mon, do it for Michael. He's had a really long day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [laughing] I don't know what he's doing.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: This is great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim! Jim! What... What's happening?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, [points to Cindy] she's asleep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh... Narcolepsy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Probably.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Now open your eyes and describe it to me.

quotes.speaker: Cindy
quotes.line: I... don't know, it has four bed rooms and a loft...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh my gosh, now she's up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And she's trying to correctly butcher a goose, but she's having trouble coming up with it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, OK. Cindy! Yo, Cindy! Cindy! Hold its neck back and insert the knife below the jaw. Bring it all the way around, there's going to be a good amount of blood. [Cindy looks confused. Woman next to Dwight is disgusted] Don't let it bother you. Have a bucket there, for the blood... and the innards... and the feathers.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh no, this is different. The CIA thing, that was a prank on Dwight. This is more like a umm... OK, it's pretty much the same thing.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: What d'ya think? [to Stanley about his drink]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Fruity and delicious.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: See, I told you. You want one Meredith?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: No thanks. They're too sweet.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Hey, so what's the status.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Looks like they forgot the power cord.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Oh, you're kidding me?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Oh, you guys, guys, um... I'm sorry, but there's a problem with the karaoke machine. [everyone sighs]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Well that blows.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Hang on little ladies. You don't need this thing, I'll go grab my synthesizer. [Everyone cheers]

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: Darryl! Darryl! Darryl! [Darryl exits break room and passes Phyllis]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Hey. Hey, look, when you get done with your... [looks inside conference room] meeting, you should, uh, come to the break room. We're having a party.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh, ok.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: All right. Se you later...

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.line: [tries to break nut on a Nutcracker doll] These nuts are really hard to crack.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Try harder then. [Hannah smashes Nutcracker on top of nut. Sees Kevin take another brownie] Uh uh. No one has seconds until everyone's had some.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: You've got to be kidding!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: You've got to be kidding. {Kevin takes bite of brownie]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Cold, huh?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Huh? [puts on jacket]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Maybe that'll help. Is it cold in there?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [referring to waitresses] They have been checking us out, all night! I am not kidding!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know what we should do?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We should invite them to the Christmas party.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Now, you are thinking. Yes. And you know what? Because you have had such a rough day, you get Cindy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, you are such mench my friend. [They stand up and do fist bump and explosion]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK, where is everybody? I would like them to meet my new girlfriend. [Guys walk in with two different waitresses from Benihana's]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'm sure they'll want to meet her, too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: The least I could do was give some poor sick kid a bike.

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.line: That rocks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Nah, you rock. Tell you what, if you want it, it's yours.

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.line: Thanks! I, I wanna give you something.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh. [She whispers in his ear. Michael starts to laugh] That's what she said.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hello? I would like everybody to meet my new girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: My new girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Where's Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.line: Is he the hot one or the giant baby?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [whispers] The giant baby. Wow, I am so sorry, I had no idea this party would be so lame.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: [under her breath] There's another party in the break room.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, party in the break room! Let's go, let's go! Thank God! Let's go to the break room.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Hey, excuse me! Waitress lady! Hey, where do you think you're going with that? [refers to toy she just took from table]

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.line: I thought I could have it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: You can't have it [takes back toy] I don't walk into your house and steal your Hello Kitty backpack.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Shhh... Shut it! C'mon! Party.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey! It's Angela! [Angela slams door shut, but not before Kevin sneaks out] Hey!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We're going to ...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [singing] I want you to know. That I'm happy for you. I wish nothing but...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I just think there are two, two specific kinds of people in the world. People who own houses and people who own condos. [turns to reach for pretzel while Second Cindy turns other direction] And... my question to you [points and pulls away other waitress] is do you agree?

quotes.speaker: Other waitress
quotes.line: Do I agree about what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do you agree about what? [laughs] Wow. You're  lucky you're so darn cute.

quotes.speaker: Other waitress
quotes.line: What're you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What're you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [singing] And I'm here to remind you of the mess you left when you went away. It's not fair, to deny me of the cross I bear that you give to me. You, you, you, you, you, you, you oughta know ta know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right [high fives Kevin]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Did you have fun at Benihana's?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No. It was awful. I couldn't hear anything. [cheers from other party]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I've had the worse day here [turns up Nutcracker music on the stereo. [Sighs. Dwight reaches for and holds Angela's hand]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: [Karen and Pam enter] Dwight, you won the raffle! [holds out gift]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No... way! Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Open it! Open it ! Open it! [Dwight rips open present. Angela is upset and Pam notices]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Do you like it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Walkie-talkies.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Can I talk to you a second?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Well the Committee to Plan Parties has served its purpose. We're gonna disband. In the name of Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [holds up rice krispie shaped like a star] In the name of Nutcracker Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Angela, we've been hearing really great thing about uh... your brownies and we were hoping you'd consider merging into two parties.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I'm not sure. Does your karaoke machine have Christmas songs?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, but we don't have a power cord.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oh, I may have seen it somewhere. [Goes to plant and picks up power cord] Is it this one?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Mmm. Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Yeah, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: We'll go tell everyone.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: OK.

quotes.speaker: Andy and Michael
quotes.line: [singing] And if you want love, we'll make it. Swim in a big sea of blankets. Take all your big plans and break 'em. This is bound to take awhile. Your body is a wonderland. [Michael notices Cindy ride up to him on the bike and looks confused] Your body is a wonderland.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Your hands.

quotes.speaker: Both
quotes.line: Your body is a wonderland.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I'll use my hands on it.

quotes.speaker: Both
quotes.line: Something 'bout the way your hair falls in your face...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [singing] Whatever we deny or embrace. For worse or for better. We belong, we belong, we belong together... Ryan...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: When you know, you just know.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Check her out. My little gal over there. Babe-alectable.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: Which one is she? [Michael stares at both waitresses]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's... it's one of those two. [points at both]

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: You don't know?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Dude, you should know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah... well, it's been hard, they're wearing the exact same uniform. And I've been drinking. And you know how all waitresses look alike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I honestly don't see what the big deal is. Stevie Wonder is married. Are you going to tell me that Stevie Wonder doesn't love his wife just because he's not sure what she looks like?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey. Where's my girl? Is she in the fridge? Where is she hiding? I don't know where she is. 'Cause I'm drunk, I can't even find her.

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.line: You know where I am.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Haha, I do! I just haven't hugged you in awhile [marks Cindy's arm with a black marker]

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.line: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, good. That felt good. Let's go. Party.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: [singing] Spinnin' n reelin with love. Give it the time, I might come back down. But it feels so good. My feet don't touch the ground. Wha..wha..wild. Wha..wha..wild. Well everybody knows, I'm crazy about 'ya...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [into walkie-talkie] Monkey, this is Possum. Do you copy?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [into another walkie-talkie] Copy, Possum. What's your twenty?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: No way. [both hold up Bridget Jones' Diary movie DVD]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What a horrible, horrible movie that was.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: And now we get to remember it forever.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Thank you. [Both hug]

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, hey, you. How are ya?

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.line: Hey. This party blows, so we're gonna leave.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no. Hey, you should stay because we are having fun and...

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.line: Cool...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Where do you wanna go?

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.line: I... We're just gonna take off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I... you know what? I, OK, listen. I like you. I really like you. So much in fact, that I would like you to accompany me on a trip to Sandals, Jamaica.

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.line: No... I have school. [leaves with other waitress and bicycle]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You want help? OK... Merry Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.line: Merry Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [singing] Lady, from the moment I saw you standing all alone. You gave all the love that I needed...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That waitress was the one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No. She wasn't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How can you be sure?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, for starters, I've known you as a couple since the beginning of the relationship, which was approximately [looks a watch] three hours ago.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Don't make fun... You're making fun of me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I guess, I didn't know her very well. I marked her arm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I, I put a mark on her arm. [Both are laughing] So I could tell them apart. I don't... I know, I know. I can't believe I gave her my bike!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, why do I feel like crap?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You just had a rebound.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I had rebound? Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah. Which, don't get me wrong, can be a really fun distraction, but, when it's over, you're left thinking about the girl you really like, the one that broke your heart.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I totally rebounded. Someone else shoots and I take the ball and I score. Well, I guess I didn't score and I'm not sure who's actually shooting, but, whatever. Doesn't matter. It's all good. Or as my ex might say. Domo arigato, Mr. Scott-o.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [singing, with Dwight holding up microphone] Little baby, parum pum pum pum. I am a poor boy too, parum pum pum pum. I have no gift to bring, parum pum pum pum. That's fit to give our King, parum pum pum pum..

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [on phone] Yes, I just wanted to see if, uh you would like to come to Jamaica with me. There's this resort called Sandals. Really? OK. All right. I promise you won't be disappointed. Umm, It's all-inclusive...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [singing] ... Shall I play for you, parum pum pum pum [Oscar and Gil walk through door]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Too soon. [both turn back around and walk out]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [singing] I played my drum for Him, parum pum pum pum. I played my best for Him, parum pum pum pum, Rum pum pum pum, rum pum pum pum.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [singing along] pum pum pum pum pum pum pum

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Bye Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Night.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [to Pam] Oh, you know what? Sorry, forgot to tell you. I intercepted a transmission earlier and it seems that the CIA is gonna need Dwight down at their headquarters in Langley for training and an ice cream social with the other agents.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: We should get him a bus ticket. [types on computer] To make his trip easier.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh no, that would be great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It costs seventy five dollars.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hmm... Well, maybe the CIA can send a helicopter?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Ohh... [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [Cell phone beeps] What the? [Reading text message] "You have been compromised. Abort mission. Destroy phone." Destroy phone? [Dwight throws phone off of the roof and walks away]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: William Randolph Shakespeare once wrote in one of his plays, and I'm paraphrasing here, "Love doth be poison." Brilliant. And a lot of people don't give Shakespeare enough credit. They think it was somebody else. A-holes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: When Michael suggested canceling Christmas, I was outraged, not on my behalf, but on behalf of baby Jesus. I mean, would he cancel Christmas because he got dumped or he was two weeks behind on his party planning, on top of the fact that his cats were ill? I think not. I think baby Jesus would suck it up and plan his party.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: We didn't have a party planning committee in Stamford. Somebody would just volunteer to run out to Carvel and pick up an ice cream cake. So the fact that they have a committee here, fascinating.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: This is ridiculous. I... I've spent so much time, like I always do. And for that little trollop to come in here and throw her own party... Are you even listening to me?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Angela, what do you want me to do?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I want you to tell her to stop, Toby. Am I being clear?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [sighing] Look, it's a free country. If she wants to throw a party...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What are you...?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: ...using her own money...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: And what...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: ...then she should be allowed to.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No she shouldn't.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: The more the merrier.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [Angela slaps Toby on the face.] Stop it.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Oww.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I'm sorry. It wasn't my intention to hurt you, but I want to wake you up to the injustice that's going on right in front of your face.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: That really hurt. I'm writing you up. [Angela makes an angry face] Hey, you are not allowed to touch other employees. Am I being clear?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Michael was so right about you. You are pathetic.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: I don't care which party I go to. Once you've danced naked at a hash bonfire with the spirits of the dead, all parties seem pretty much the same.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I think I'll go to Angela's party, because that's the party I know.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Where would you like the Rice Krispy Treat stars?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: They're Sugarplum fairy wands.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Sugarplum fairy wands.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: It's like you weren't even at the meeting.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I'm going to the party in the break room, because they have more chairs in there. If I have to stand around a long time, I get real unpleasant to be around.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [Phyllis puts down phone] Hmm hmm. [Phyllis gets up and goes to Angela's party]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no, no. You know what, I better hold off. I wanna make sure I don't dial Carol before I get drunk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: So, really, you're just calling her?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah. You know what? I am. I'm gonna call her. That's a good idea.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [from across the table] Where's Michael going? Michael? Is he sick? Is he choking?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [on [phone] No, I don't think I'm asking too much. I think it's only fair that you tell me exactly what I did wrong. Okay. Uh huh. Well that... yeah. Uh huh. All right. Well, could you tell me something that I did right?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [knocks on office wall] Hey.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Hello, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Merry Christmas. [hands over a gift]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Oh, thank you. Do you always get presents for your ex-girlfriends?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Okay, we're never technically... um is there.. Is there a problem?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Well, I didn't get you anything, because you have treated me inconsiderately, and I'm not gonna stand for that anymore.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Um That's... That's fair. I'm sorry. Merry Christmas. [Ryan starts walking away.]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [runnning after him] Wait, Ryan, you're not mean. You're adorable. I'm so sorry. I got you a present, too. But then when I got to work, I didn't see anything on my desk from you, so I threw it away. And then Asuncion took the trash out, that's why I think it's in the dumpster. I'm so sorry. I'm the worst. [Kelly hugs Ryan]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: There's no fizz in this punch. Phyllis!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I'll just go get a ginger ale.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No, I've got it, Phyllis. Stay. Have fun. Eat your wand.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [talking to Kelly in dumpster] Hey, Kelly, you know what? Throw my gift away, too.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [from inside dumpster] No, you paid money for that CD.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I'm serious. It'll show that we don't care about material things.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I don't understand.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Kelly, I'm so cold!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [starts to cry] You don't have to scream at me.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Are you having fun in this relationship?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Sometimes.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I don't know Kelly, sometimes I look at us and I think...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [crying] Don't dump me while I'm in the dumpster. Just go back inside if you're so cold. I'll just stay in the dumpster. [Ryan smirks]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [both inside dumpster] Did you look over here?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Who's eating all these apples?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: And what are these? Are... Why are there egg yolks in here? Aren't you supposed to eat the yolks?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Michael was on an egg-yolk diet. He's so weird.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Do you think I should diet?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: No, you're perfect. [Kelly gasps] What? Did you find it?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: No, I'm scared.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: All of a sudden?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Uh huh. Hold me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, honey, here's Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: He is also in an interracial relationship, so, you know, if you have any problems, you can always call him.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Oh, you're gonna face far greater problems than I can possibly help you with.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Sounds good. Okay, let's go.
